page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content:
adjacent to the sea front, which in the summer months gain trade from the tourists, while twice weekly there is a market. On the promenade along the sea front there a multitude of beach huts many of which may be rented by the tourists staying in Walton.
In Walton itself traffic congestion severely affects the High Street during the summer months especially with the number of daytrippers. The permanent solution to this congestion would be a relief road. This would 'syphon off'vehicular traffic bound for the Yacht Club area of the town. This scheme has been given the 'go ahead' by the council and they suggested that the applicant for the marina development should construct the first stage of the road past the council car park between Mill Street
